content.text: 1/2 cup all-purpose flour
content.eamr: ( ing-0 "1/2 cup all-purpose flour" )

content.text: 1 tablespoon light brown sugar
content.eamr: ( ing-1 "1 tablespoon light brown sugar" )

content.text: 1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon
content.eamr: ( ing-2 "1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon" )

content.text: 1/8 teaspoon salt
content.eamr: ( ing-3 "1/8 teaspoon salt" )

content.text: 2 tablespoons unsalted butter
content.eamr: ( ing-4 "2 tablespoons unsalted butter" )

content.text: 1 1/2 tablespoons ice water
content.eamr: ( ing-5 "1 1/2 tablespoons ice water" )

content.text: 1 cup skim milk
content.eamr: ( ing-6 "1 cup skim milk" )

content.text: 3 egg whites
content.eamr: ( ing-7 "3 egg whites" )

content.text: 2 tablespoons white sugar
content.eamr: ( ing-8 "2 tablespoons white sugar" )

content.text: 1/4 teaspoon vanilla extract
content.eamr: ( ing-9 "1/4 teaspoon vanilla extract" )

content.text: 1 bananas, peeled and sliced
content.eamr: ( ing-10 "1 bananas, peeled and sliced" )

content.text: 1 kiwi, peeled and sliced
content.eamr: ( ing-11 "1 kiwi, peeled and sliced" )

content.text: 1 cup sliced fresh strawberries
content.eamr: ( ing-12 "1 cup sliced fresh strawberries" )

content.text: 0) In a bowl, sift together the flour, light brown sugar, cinnamon, and salt.
content.eamr:
( inst-0 / R
	:inform ( ac-0-0 "sift"@14:18 / AC
		:ppt ( ing-0 "the flour"@28:37 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-1 "light brown sugar"@39:56 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-2 "cinnamon"@58:66 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-3 "salt"@72:76 / FOOD )
		:loc ( tool-0-0 "a bowl"@6:12 / TOOL )
	)
)

content.text: 1) Cut in the butter until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
content.eamr:
( inst-1 / R
	:inform ( ac-1-0 "Cut in"@3:9 / AC
		:ppt ( ing-4 "the butter"@10:20 / FOOD )
		:until ( cond-1-0 "until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs"@21:62 / CONDITION_CLAUSE )
		:ppt ( NULL / FOOD )
	)
)

content.text: 2) Sprinkle with the ice water, and toss the mixture with a fork until evenly moistened.
content.eamr:
( inst-2 / R
	:inform ( ac-2-0 "Sprinkle"@3:11 / AC
		:ppt ( ing-5 "the ice water"@17:30 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( NULL / FOOD )
	)
	:inform ( ac-2-1 "toss"@36:40 / AC
		:ppt ( "the mixture"@41:52 / FOOD )
		:instrument ( tool-2-0 "a fork"@58:64 / TOOL )
		:until ( cond-2-0 "until evenly moistened"@65:87 / CONDITION_CLAUSE )
	)
)

content.text: 3) Pat into a round, and wrap in plastic.
4) Refrigerate for 30 minutes.
5) In the top half of a double boiler, heat the milk until it begins to bubble.
content.eamr:
( inst-5 / R
	:inform ( ac-5-0 "heat"@39:43 / AC
		:ppt ( ing-6 "the milk"@44:52 / FOOD )
		:until ( cond-5-0 "until it begins to bubble"@53:78 / CONDITION_CLAUSE )
		:ppt ( tool-5-0 "the top half of a double boiler"@6:37 / TOOL )
	)
)

content.text: 6) In a bowl, beat together the egg whites, sugar, and 1 tablespoon of the hot milk.
content.eamr:
( inst-6 / R
	:inform ( ac-6-0 "beat"@14:18 / AC
		:ppt ( ing-7 "the egg whites"@28:42 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-8 "sugar"@44:49 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( "1 tablespoon of the hot milk"@55:83 / FOOD )
		:loc ( tool-6-0 "a bowl"@6:12 / TOOL )
	)
)

content.text: 7) Whisk the egg white mixture into the remaining hot milk.
8) Cook and stir without boiling about 10 minutes, until the mixture is thick enough to coat the back of a metal spoon.
content.eamr:
( inst-8 / R
	:inform ( ac-8-0 "Cook and stir"@-1:-1 / AC
		:duration ( dur-8-0 "10 minutes"@39:49 / DUR )
		:until ( cond-8-0 "until the mixture is thick enough"@51:84 / CONDITION_CLAUSE )
		:todo ( "without boiling"@-1:-1 / OTHER )
		:prp ( purp-8-0 "to coat the back of a metal spoon"@85:118 / PURPOSE_CLAUSE )
	)
)

content.text: 9) Remove from heat, and stir in the vanilla.
10) Cool to room temperature.
11) Preheat oven to 375  degrees F (190 degrees C).
content.eamr:
( inst-11 / R
	:inform ( ac-11-0 "Preheat"@4:11 / AC
		:ppt ( tool-11-0 "oven"@12:16 / TOOL )
		:heat ( temp-11-0 "375  degrees F"@20:34 / TEMPERATURE )
		:heat ( temp-11-1 "190 degrees C"@36:49 / TEMPERATURE )
	)
)

content.text: 12) Lightly grease an 8 inch tart pan with a removable bottom.
13) On a floured surface, roll the tart dough out to 1/4 inch thickness.
content.eamr:
( inst-13 / R
	:inform ( ac-13-0 "roll"@26:30 / AC
		:ppt ( "the tart dough"@31:45 / FOOD )
		:reshape ( "1/4 inch thickness"@53:71 / FOOD )
		:loc ( tool-13-0 "a floured surface"@7:24 / TOOL )
	)
)

content.text: 14) Press the chilled dough into the prepared tart pan.
15) Trim the edges, and pierce the bottom with a fork.
16) Bake 15 to 18 minutes in the preheated oven, until golden brown.
content.eamr:
( inst-16 / R
	:inform ( ac-16-0 "Bake"@4:8 / AC
		:duration ( dur-16-0 "15 to 18 minutes"@9:25 / DUR )
		:loc ( tool-16-0 "the preheated oven"@29:47 / TOOL )
		:until ( cond-16-0 "until golden brown"@49:67 / CONDITION_CLAUSE )
		:ppt ( NULL / FOOD )
	)
)

content.text: 17) Remove to a wire rack, and cool completely.
18) Spoon the filling mixture into the crust.
19) Bake 18 to 20 minutes in the preheated oven.
content.eamr:
( inst-19 / R
	:inform ( ac-19-0 "Bake"@4:8 / AC
		:duration ( dur-19-0 "18 to 20 minutes"@9:25 / DUR )
		:loc ( tool-19-0 "the preheated oven"@29:47 / TOOL )
		:ppt ( NULL / FOOD )
	)
)

content.text: 20) Cool to room temperature on a wire rack.
21) Refrigerate 8 hours.
